channel.title: Getting Time
channel.description: Hey everyone, I'm writing a clock for my website and I need to get the global time and change it to EST, BUT I don't know what code I need to do it!!!! Does anyone know how I can receive a global time or something through an Applet? If you need some more info, just let me know :p

item.title: Getting Time
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“iwasinmoparseas101class, post:3, topic:37896”]but if the website is being hosted off of someone else’s server…would that work?[/quote]If someone is running this from a website, it has nothing to do with the server, so yes.

If it’s being run on a server, it’ll have to have a JVM installed, which, in turn, would make that work.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Time
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

System.currentTimeMillis();
returns the amount of milliseconds since the start of the year 1970 in Greenwich Mean Time

so i suppose you could do that then change to hours, minuites, seconds, then add 40 years, take away enough to be Eastern time

or you could find the website of one of those laboratorys that keep time down to the solar second, then find a way to get it off them

Read full topic
